title: Anwar to undertake two-day working visit to Brunei starting Sunday
summary: Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim will embark on a two-day working visit to Brunei from Aug 25 to 26 for the 25th Malaysia-Brunei Darussalam Annual Leaders’ Consultation (ALC), touted as the highest bilateral mechanism between the two nations.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (Aug 24): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim will embark on a two-day working visit to Brunei from Aug 25 to 26 for the 25th Malaysia-Brunei Darussalam Annual Leaders’ Consultation (ALC), touted as the highest bilateral mechanism between the two nations.

Malaysia’s Foreign Ministry, also known as Wisma Putra, said in a statement on Saturday that during the 25th ALC, Anwar and the Sultan of Brunei, Sultan Hassanal Bolkiah, will review the progress of bilateral cooperation and discuss outstanding

title: Sinkhole incident: Two more manholes to be checked, says Dr Zaliha
summary: The search and rescue (SAR) operation to locate the Indian tourist who fell into a sinkhole along Jalan Masjid India on Friday will now focus on the last two manholes on the sewer line leading to the Indah Water Konsortium (IWK) Pantai Dalam treatment plant.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 24): The search and rescue (SAR) operation to locate the Indian tourist who fell into a sinkhole along Jalan Masjid India on Friday will now focus on the last two manholes on the sewer line leading to the Indah Water Konsortium (IWK) Pantai Dalam treatment plant.

Minister in the Prime Minister’s Department (Federal Territories) Dr Zaliha Mustafa said the two manholes were at Dataran Merdeka and Kinabalu roundabout, adding that four other manholes, at Wisma Yakin, Jalan Melayu, the Jalan Melay

title: Too early for BN to decide whether to go 'solo’ in next polls — Mohamad Hasan
summary: It is too early to conclude whether Barisan Nasional (BN) and Umno can go 'solo' in the 16th general election (GE16), said BN deputy chairman Datuk Seri Mohamad Hasan.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 24): It is too early to conclude whether Barisan Nasional (BN) and Umno can go 'solo' in the 16th general election (GE16), said BN deputy chairman Datuk Seri Mohamad Hasan.

Instead, Mohamad, who is also Umno deputy president, said the party leadership would thoroughly examine the matter when the time comes, based on the party's situation at that time.

“We cannot assess ourselves now for 2027. When the time for the election draws near, we will s

title: Amid flight disruptions, MAG to temporarily reduce its network from now to December
summary: Malaysia Aviation Group Bhd (MAG), the parent company of national carrier Malaysia Airlines Bhd, said it is temporarily reducing its network between now and December to execute corrective measures where needed.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 24): Malaysia Aviation Group Bhd (MAG), the parent company of national carrier Malaysia Airlines Bhd, said it is temporarily reducing its network between now and December to execute corrective measures where needed.

This follows recent disruptions that took place on the week of Aug 19 involving the services of Malaysia Airlines, its low-cost arm Firefly and Amal, which provides Hajj and Umrah pilgrimage flights.

When contacted on Saturday, an M

title: Search for Masjid India sinkhole victim expands to six sewer routes
summary: Six sewage manholes around the search and rescue (SAR) operation site for the victim of the sinkhole in front of Malayan Mansion, Jalan Masjid India, are being opened in stages to expand the search area.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 24): Six sewage manholes around the search and rescue (SAR) operation site for the victim of the sinkhole in front of Malayan Mansion, Jalan Masjid India, are being opened in stages to expand the search area.

Dang Wangi District police chief ACP Sulizmie Affendy Sulaiman said the decision to open the manholes, with assistance from Indah Water Konsortium (IWK), was made following discussions with relevant agencies at 10.30am on Saturday.

"In our

title: Masjid India sinkhole: Police advise vendors to temporarily close due to toxic gas risk
summary: Vendors on Jalan Masjid India are advised to temporarily close their businesses to avoid the risk of exposure to toxic gases that may be released from the manholes during the search operation for the victim of the sinkhole that occurred on Friday morning.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 24): Vendors on Jalan Masjid India are advised to temporarily close their businesses to avoid the risk of exposure to toxic gases that may be released from the manholes during the search operation for the victim of the sinkhole that occurred on Friday morning.

Dang Wangi District police chief ACP Sulizmie Affendy Sulaiman advised that while the vicinity of Jalan Masjid India is currently safe, precautionary measures should still be taken, as such gas leaks could pose health risks to both visi

title: The local impact of climate change
summary: Asia, a vast and diverse region, will collectively suffer some of the worst impact of climate change. Home to mostly developing countries, the region may not have the resources to effectively mitigate and adapt to the crisis. A large portion of its dense population resides in low-lying coastal towns, which are exposed to the increasing impact of climate change.
content: This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on August 12, 2024 - August 18, 2024

title: Govt activates operations room to monitor mpox outbreak
summary: The government has activated a special operations room at the National Crisis Preparedness and Response Centre (CPRC) from Aug 16, to monitor and prevent the spread of the monkeypox (mpox) outbreak.
content:
DUNGUN (Aug 24): The government has activated a special operations room at the National Crisis Preparedness and Response Centre (CPRC) from Aug 16, to monitor and prevent the spread of the monkeypox (mpox) outbreak.

Health Minister Datuk Seri D Dzulkefly Ahmad said the operations room is tasked with overseeing the outbreak both domestically and internationally, while also coordinating with Asean countries on preventive and control measures.

"We are actively moni

title: Malaysia begins exporting fresh durians to China on Saturday — deputy minister
summary: Malaysia began exporting fresh durians to China on Saturday, two months after signing the Protocol on Phytosanitary Requirements for the Export of Fresh Durian from Malaysia to China, said Deputy Agriculture and Food Security Minister Datuk Arthur Joseph Kurup.
content:
SEPANG (Aug 24): Malaysia began exporting fresh durians to China on Saturday, two months after signing the Protocol on Phytosanitary Requirements for the Export of Fresh Durian from Malaysia to China, said Deputy Agriculture and Food Security Minister Datuk Arthur Joseph Kurup.

He said that fresh durians have now been allowed into the Chinese market starting this year, whereas previously, only frozen durians could be exported to the country.

He added that for a

title: Fire dept: 21 stranded at Risda Eco Park Resort rescued
summary: All 19 visitors and two staff members of the Risda Eco Park Resort, who were stranded due to a water surge incident on Friday, were rescued around noon on Saturday, said Perak Fire and Rescue Department Zone 4 chief Khairil Adli Zakaria.
content:
TANJUNG MALIM (Aug 24): All 19 visitors and two staff members of the Risda Eco Park Resort, who were stranded due to a water surge incident on Friday, were rescued around noon on Saturday, said Perak Fire and Rescue Department Zone 4 chief Khairil Adli Zakaria.

Khairil Adli, who led the operations, said that the group, which included 14 adults and seven children, was rescued by crossing the river using ropes and a boat.

“We faced a strong current in Sungai Gelit

title: Fahmi tells DBKL, utility companies to collaborate on mapping underground utilities
summary: Kuala Lumpur City Hall (DBKL), along with the relevant agencies and utility companies, are advised to collaborate in mapping underground utilities to avoid unwanted incidents, especially when a development project is underway.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 24): Kuala Lumpur City Hall (DBKL), along with the relevant agencies and utility companies, are advised to collaborate in mapping underground utilities to avoid unwanted incidents, especially when a development project is underway.

Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil said that mapping utilities is crucial to understanding the underground situation, as many areas contain pipelines and electric cables are sometimes not accurately mapped by utility companies.

title: Reality check for cross-border RE
summary: Just two months ago, Malaysia’s pilot auction for green electricity exports to Singapore closed with 100MW capacity set for the island state for one year from September.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 24): Just two months ago, Malaysia’s pilot auction for green electricity exports to Singapore closed with 100MW capacity set for the island state for one year from September.

To the surprise of many, the pilot saw a muted response. Industry participants point to three issues: obstacles in recognising green attributes of renewable energy (RE) procured from another country, pricing of RE sold from Malaysia, and the country’s packaging of this “product” called RE.

title: Search for sinkhole victim to resume on Saturday morning
summary: The search and rescue (SAR) operation for a female Indian national who fell into a sinkhole along Jalan Masjid India here on Friday will resume on Saturday morning.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 24): The search and rescue (SAR) operation for a female Indian national who fell into a sinkhole along Jalan Masjid India here on Friday will resume on Saturday morning.

It is understood that agencies involved in the SAR, including the Fire and Rescue Department, the Malaysian Civil Defence Force, the police, Kuala Lumpur City Hall and Indah Water Consortium were holding discussions on the operation.

As of 10.30am, the SAR operation has not yet

title: Licensing of social media providers is to ensure users' protection, safety, says MCMC's deputy MD
summary: The government's decision to mandate licensing for social media providers, effective Jan 1, 2025, is a proactive step aimed at safeguarding the interests and safety of users.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 24): The government's decision to mandate licensing for social media providers, effective Jan 1, 2025, is a proactive step aimed at safeguarding the interests and safety of users.

Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) deputy managing director Datuk Zulkarnain Mohd Yasin said this regulation is a crucial legal intervention to maintain public order and preserve national harmony.

"Given the rapid advancement of telecommunicatio

title: The Week Ahead: US July core PCE data in focus; big-cap corporates to release earnings results
summary: Hogging the limelight next week could be the US core personal consumption expenditure (PCE) for July, which is slated to be announced on Aug 30. The PCE measures the spending on goods and services by consumers in the US and is seen as the Federal Reserve’s preferred inflation gauge.
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on August 26, 2024 - September 1, 2024

Hogging the limelight next week could be the US core personal consumption expenditure (PCE) for July, which is slated to be announced on Aug 30. The PCE measures the spending on goods and services by consumers in the US and is seen as the Federal Reserve’s preferred inflation gauge.

The core PCE, which will be updated for Ju

title: Sinkhole incident: 17-hour search turns up only victim's slippers
summary: Rescuers looking for the Indian tourist who fell into a sinkhole that opened up at her feet in Jalan Masjid India here could only find a pair of slippers belonging to her near the location after almost 17 hours of searching on Friday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 24): Rescuers looking for the Indian tourist who fell into a sinkhole that opened up at her feet in Jalan Masjid India here could only find a pair of slippers belonging to her near the location after almost 17 hours of searching on Friday.

Kuala Lumpur police chief Datuk Rusdi Mohd Isa said the slippers were found floating in the excavated area in the morning of the incident.

"We took a long time to look for the victim and the scuba team also e

title: [EXCLUSIVE] Airlines reminded of responsibilities
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Airlines operating in the country have been told that they must provide meals, telephone calls and internet access for flight delays of two hours or more.Aviation regulator Malaysian Aviation Commission (Mavcom) said if the delays are at ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Airlines operating in the country have been told that they must provide meals, telephone calls and internet access for flight delays of two hours or more.

Aviation regulator Malaysian Aviation Commission (Mavcom) said if the delays are at least five hours, they must provide accommodation and transportation to and from the hotel as well.

Mavcom was responding to Business Times following a spate of flight disruptions recently including those by Malaysia Airlines Bhd and Firefly that had caused an uproar among

summary: The rally in US stocks faces an important test next week with earnings from chipmaking giant Nvidia, whose blistering run has powered markets throughout 2024.
content:

title: Oil climbs over 2% after Powell indicates rate cuts
summary: US light crude oil gained more than 2% a barrel on Friday after comments by US Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell indicated the central bank was preparing to cut interest rates.
content:
Brent crude futures settled up by US$1.80, or 2.33%, at US$79.02 a barrel. US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude futures finished up US$1.82, or 2.49%, at US$74.83.

HOUSTON: US light crude oil gained more than 2% a barrel on Friday after comments by US Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell indicated the central bank was preparing to cut interest rates.

title: US stocks end higher as Powell cements rate cut hopes
summary: US stocks rallied on Friday as dovish remarks from US Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell solidified expectations that the central bank will cut its key policy rate in September.
content:
The Dow rose 462.3 points, or 1.14%, to 41,175.08, the S&P 500 gained 63.97 points, or 1.15%, to 5,634.61 and the Nasdaq added 258.44 points, or 1.47%, to 17,877.79.

title: How will insurance co-payments play into the healthcare system?
summary: A state of anxiety and trepidation has overtaken many members of the public as the looming deadline of co-payments for health insurance comes closer.
content:
A state of anxiety and trepidation has overtaken many members of the public as the looming deadline of co-payments for health insurance comes closer.

Their fears are multi-pronged – will they be forced to swap their existing policies into co-payment ones?

content:
The Fed’s cutting of interest rates will help reflate global liquidity. — Reuters

title: The effects of Trump’s protectionist policies if he wins the race
summary: Malaysian investors are never tired of repeating the mantra: “Whenever the US sneezes, the world catches a cold.”
content:
Republican presidential nominee and former US President Donald Trump. — Reuters

MALAYSIAN investors are never tired of repeating the mantra: “Whenever the US sneezes, the world catches a cold.”

These days, the effect of the sneeze may be increasingly shared with China, befitting its status as Malaysia’s largest trading partner.

title: SimeProp in sync with government’s housing aims

content:
Sime Darby Property group managing director Datuk Seri Azmir Merican.

title: Higher wages – a key reform agenda
summary: When the Madani Economy framework was launched at the end of July last year, one of the key challenges that were identified was the low labour share of income at just 32.4% as well as the low monthly median wages of RM2,250 based on 2022 data.
content:
WHEN the Madani Economy framework was launched at the end of July last year, one of the key challenges that were identified was the low labour share of income at just 32.4% as well as the low monthly median wages of RM2,250 based on 2022 data.

Fast forward to 2024, Malaysia’s median wages have increased to RM2,844 as at the first quarter of this year, a jump of 26.4% compared with the level seen in 2022.

title: Seven & i takeover proposal tests Japan’s commitment to M&A
summary: A proposed takeover of Seven & i Holdings Co that could result in the sale of one of Japan’s strongest brands marks the first big test of the country’s evolving investor-friendly stance.
content:
After years of activist investors pushing for change and unconsummated attempts from abroad to buy big companies, the deal is being keenly observed at home and abroad. — Bloomberg

A proposed takeover of Seven & i Holdings Co that could result in the sale of one of Japan’s strongest brands marks the first big test of the country’s evolving investor-friendly stance.

title: Fixing the creaking public healthcare system
summary: It is a given that the state of public healthcare in Malaysia leaves much to be desired. It is known for long waiting times and being overcrowded.
content:
Lum: Healthcare has to be looked at as an investment.

IT is a given that the state of public healthcare in Malaysia leaves much to be desired. It is known for long waiting times and being overcrowded.

Employees are underpaid and overworked with fewer joining the sector. Many good specialists have been leaving the public sector for the private sector. So too are nurses.

title: Moderate growth for residential
summary: The residential property market, which has seen steady growth so far this year, is expected to continue its positive trajectory for the remainder of 2024, according to property consultants.
content:
PPC International MD Datuk Siders Sittampalam.

THE residential property market, which has seen steady growth so far this year, is expected to continue its positive trajectory for the remainder of 2024, according to property consultants.

Despite the upbeat outlook, they expect moderate growth in terms of value and volume.

title: Ringgit finds strength amid weak US dollar
summary: Global markets were marked by cautious sentiment as investors awaited the weekend’s Jackson Hole symposium of central bankers.
content:
GLOBAL markets were marked by cautious sentiment as investors awaited the weekend’s Jackson Hole symposium of central bankers.

Markets were driven by the weak US dollar while the US government bond yields were testing yearly lows due to sustained expectations that the US Federal Reserve (Fed) will commit to cutting interest rates at the next Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting in September.

content:
EPB Group Bhd managing director Yeoh Chee Min.

title: Why are Main Market IPOs declining?
summary: A total of 12 years have passed since Felda Global Ventures Holdings Bhd (FGV) made its debut on the Main Market of Bursa Malaysia.
content:
Tradeview Capital Sdn Bhd chief executive officer Ng Zhu Hann.

A total of 12 years have passed since Felda Global Ventures Holdings Bhd (FGV) made its debut on the Main Market of Bursa Malaysia.

In those 12 years, no company has beaten FGV’s record of raising RM10.4bil from its initial public offering (IPO). FGV was also the world’s second-largest IPO in 2012, just behind Facebook Inc.

title: Addressing the immediate need for skilled workers
summary: The de-risking of global supply chains from China to countries including Malaysia needs to be complemented with policy responses that are appropriate, accurate and adequate to address the immediate pressing need for skilled workers such as engineers.

Deputy Investment, Trade and Industry Minister Liew Chin Tong.

title: TM's deal to buy DNB stake terminated
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Digital Nasional Bhd (DNB) says the share subscription agreement (SSA) with Telekom Malaysia Bhd (TM) has been terminated today.This follows the expiration of the conditions precedent longstop date for TM with respect to the SSA on Aug 21....
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Digital Nasional Bhd (DNB) says the share subscription agreement (SSA) with Telekom Malaysia Bhd (TM) has been terminated today.

This follows the expiration of the conditions precedent longstop date for TM with respect to the SSA on Aug 21.

TM had on Dec 1 last year signed the SSA with the Minister of Finance (Incorporated) (MoF Inc) to buy a stake in the later.

DNB said the longstop date for TM was previously extended from June 21 this year to Aug 21 to enable TM to seek its shareholders' approva
